review_text_pro: I have nothing bad to say about my experience with Grow Therapy. It allows therapists to do what they love (therapy) while taking care of the administrative stuff that most therapists do not enjoy and as such we are able to focus our energy on the clients rather than worry about billing, credentialing, etc. They are very supportive of their staff and are very prompt to answer any questions you might have. In most instances, the response has been immediately or less than 1/2 hour. They have many events you can attend to get familiar with the software, get to know other staff, and be supported by other therapists as well. I love that they have a social hour that allows us to get to know each other and not feel isolated. I am also enjoying the clients through this platform as they seems to be more committed to their goals and put in the effort.
review_text_con: I wish I could decide when I wanted to get paid. You basically get paid every Monday but I guess that is not a bad thing if you get broke soon :)

review_text_pro: Growing Mission Focussed Pay for the position Growth Opportunity Challenging work Team
review_text_con: Company is having some growing pains as it scales but nothing that would discourage me from recommending it.

review_text_pro: Flexibility is very possible here
review_text_con: Delayed issue response if after normal work hours, which is understandable

review_text_pro: It is nice to be apart of a company that is so transparent about all the moving parts and open to ideas. When you see the big picture, it is easy to stay motivated toward the aligned mission.
review_text_con: Patience is needed as with any startup company that wants to mindfully grows.

review_text_pro: - I'm really proud to work for Grow - our provider-centric mission guides everything we do - Amazing people - collaborative, supportive, humble - Great work life balance - wellness is the core of our employee experience - Engaging work
review_text_con: As expected, Grow is experiencing some growing pains as we scale. Processes that were working when we were a smaller company needed to be improved upon.

review_person: Licensed Clinical Professional Counselor in Carlsbad, CA
review_text_pro: Contracting with Grow Therapy has been a dream come true for me. I had a 6 month plan to see clients through Grow on weekends and in the evenings, and just 3 weeks after starting to take referrals my private practice is thriving to the point where I am able to leave my very stressful 9-5 job and commit to my private practice full time! Grow has made everything easy! Honestly if I had to do my own marketing, scheduling, and billing I think I would be completely overwhelmed with the administrative side of things and would not be able to so enthusiastically support so many clients. When I first started looking in to contracting with Grow and was reading practitioners' reviews I kept saying to myself this is just too good to be true. I still say this to myself every single day! And then I remind myself that it is really happening!
review_text_con: I wish Grow was able to offer me affordable health insurance.

review_title: It's not a myth to love the place you work
review_person: Technical Recruiter in New York, NY
review_text_pro: - Incredible culture of celebrating wins, uplifting one another, mental health focus, work life balance, companionship - Work that is meaningful and impactful: we are changing an entire industry to create accessibility for all for mental health. Who can't get behind that mission? - Co-founders are incredible human beings who care deeply about each and every employee - Company onsites, meetings and more to make everyone feel a part of it - Really nice optional new york office with free lunch - Mental health block 2 hours every week, unlimited PTO with an enforced minimum. - Ability to own your work and be trusted without any micro management. It doesn't get better than this.
review_text_con: - Not a single con that I can think of.

review_title: Flexible and mission driven on mental health
review_person: Provider Growth Associate in Vista, CA
review_text_pro: Working on a dynamic team that is focused on changing the landscape of mental health. We are driven to help therapists and prescribers reach their professional aspirations and helping people use their insurance to find mental healthcare services.
review_text_con: Growing pains of a start up, the dynamics can be difficult to adjust with.

review_text_pro: You have complete freedom as to how you want to run your practice so you decide your hours of work. Grow makes it very easy to go through the credentialing process and you receive very good support throughout the process too. Platform is user friendly and staff is always ready to assist if you encounter challenges. Support staff is responsive and is eager to implement feedback from therapist when it comes to making improvements to the platform. Great compensation compared to other virtual platforms
review_text_con: The platform could benefit from further simplifying some content

review_person: Private Practice Therapist in Columbus, OH
review_text_pro: Therapists can set their own schedules (remember, you will be running your own practice. Grow takes care of administrative tasks). Support from other therapists across the nation. Numerous education tools are available to therapists. The company promotes you, at no cost, via Psychology Today. Grow staff members are always available to answer questions. You can reach clients in any and all states in which you are licensed.
review_text_con: Thus far, I see none.

review_text_pro: Community, Compensation, free marketing, bonuses, free credentialing
review_text_con: Sometimes support can take awhile to respond to questions

review_text_pro: I have been very happy partnering with Grow Therapy. It does require clients to choose you as a therapist, but I have received many clients from Grow. Expect your caseload to take a few months (3-7mon) to build your practice into a full time gig. If you are ready for slow and steady building of a client base, this company partner is for you.
review_text_con: None the I have encountered.

review_text_pro: I started at Grow shortly after the new year, and it has been an amazing experience so far! Everyone has been incredibly kind and welcoming, their is next-level experience and intellect to learn from, and the work-life boundaries are great.
review_text_con: Projects and communications are fast-paced, but everyone is always willing to answer questions!

review_text_pro: You set your own hours and there are tons of support for questions. Very easy to get started.
review_text_con: Must be patient in building a caseload to meet your needs.

review_title: Perfect platform to start your private practice!
review_person: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in San Francisco, CA
review_text_pro: flexibility, lots of referrals, work from anywhere, user-friendly platform, positive work culture, competitive compensation
review_text_con: The only con I can truly think of is no 401k options...which is something I understand given the contractor role.

review_text_pro: I enjoy the Circle community, my caseload has grown very quickly, I was credentialed very quickly with a number of insurance providers and from the start (recruitment until now) customer service has been top tier (especially quick email responses). On top of all of that, now GROW therapy is paying for my Psychology Today profile and there's reoccurring subscription fees. P.S. I also loved the money tree sent to me!
review_text_con: Nothing. I love being a part of the GROW community.

review_title: Couldn't have done it without Grow
review_text_pro: Grow has been amazingly helpful; in starting my practice. I was onboarded and started seeing patients within 2 months (and a large part of that was simply due to the holidays). I stand by that Grow was truly made for therapists. I tried other similar platforms and they were not nearly as supportive of the therapists.
review_text_con: My only downside is not receiving as many in-person referrals as I would like.

review_text_pro: The best reasons are ease, connection and autonomy. Truly they make the paperwork, easy! The platform is user friendly. We also have a community that is very connected (even though we are all over the US) via an app that functions similar to FaceBook. We can refer to each other, ask opinions or treatment suggestions. Lastly, you work for you! Grow just takes care of the parts that make growing your practice, enjoyable.
review_text_con: Some kinks are still being worked out with the Grow platform. I don’t have any complaints but occasionally you hear of someone trying to fix an issue with how the platform functions or what it offers.

review_text_pro: Grow is constantly improving their platform. They are extremely supportive and informative and seem to be available 7 days a week. Sometimes, they even answer a question within one hour on a Sunday. Scheduling has become much easier. Submitting invoices is a breeze. The company put us on ZocDoc and will expand marketing. I have thought of going out on my own but why bother? Grow does everything for you and it the best pay of any online company.
review_text_con: A learning curve like anything but there are great videos and support chat.

review_person: Mental Health Clinician in Silver Spring, MD
review_text_pro: set own schedule, weekly payments, discounted CEUs, health insurance available if interested, ongoing support
review_text_con: although discounted, expanded virtual platform must be paid by clinician

review_text_pro: Great platform, lots of support, awesome connections with other providers, office hours, help during the onboarding process and ability to choose your available hours.
review_text_con: May be challenging for new therapists without experience and some administrative issues (e.g., client completion of initial paperwork, no shows) which is to be expected.

review_text_pro: Great Compensation Support Flexible schedule
review_text_con: Would be helpful to be able to speak with an actual person on the phone.

review_text_pro: Great company , I have a full practice because of grow and they make billing and scheduling so easy . I now can concentrate on my clients. I fully recommend them
review_text_con: None to report I am happy

review_person: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Lindsay, CA
review_text_pro: The admin team and other providers are very helpful. I like that there is an opportunity to seek help 24/7.
review_text_con: Some insurances do not bill for no shows or late cancellations.

review_text_pro: Online community and easy onboarding
review_text_con: Slow to start (as expected with credentialing)

review_text_pro: I love how I can make my own schedule around my kids schedules but still have consistent work coming in. The pay is good and the company is awesome to work for!
review_text_con: The only con I have found it the note taking is a little confusing but it gets easier as you go. This could also be because this is the first company that I have had to do notes for insurance.

review_text_pro: I am so thankful that Grow allows me to do what I'm good at and help people! I can do my job with no worry and helpful support and a great support community of others that are passionate about helping others. I feel so supported and I Grow everyday with them. They are very honest and transparent about their company. They were being very honest that they handle the business side, so I can focus on the growth of my clients. Thankful for this company.
review_text_con: None, every company has growing areas, I go with flow

review_person: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Redding, CA
review_text_pro: Huge compensation, biggest I’ve seen. Use your own hours and synced Google calendar to schedule clients. Responsive staff. Allows for true independence than other seen from other Telehealth. You can use your own EHR if you want. They credential you and handle all the billing!
review_text_con: There’s more of a dashboard than an EHR but can still document with in the system. It takes a minute to get paid, approx 3 weeks, but typical with insurance companies.

review_text_pro: Great life work balance. Easy note submission and billing process.
review_text_con: Not enough support. You have to wait 24 hours for a response.

review_title: Great Flexible Additive to my Practice
review_text_pro: Grow offers the flexibility to take on as many or as little clients as I want too. They handle all of the onboarding and payment/insurance information with all clients.
review_text_con: No paid time off allotment, as you are paid by only the services you provide.

review_title: Grow Therapy is the place to get your private practice started!
review_text_pro: Great flexibility create your own hours Pay See the clients I want
review_text_con: There are no cons. Grow has been great.

review_title: Supportive Community and Quality Therapy at Grow
review_text_pro: They offer support via phone, internet, zoom. They have office hours multiple times per week to connect, answer questions, consultation. They assist with referrals, billing and payment. They have an organized system of notes and intake procedures. They have a large library of resources to use.
review_text_con: As you know in therapy, it takes time to credential and to grow your therapy clients, this is not a con of Grow therapy, it is just the process.

review_text_pro: I have worked at Grow for two full months. It is easy and self explanatory. Help is always available.
review_text_con: Limited insurances accepted. Initial booking complated for some clients.

review_person: Licensed Professional Counselor in Mission, TX
review_text_pro: Absolutely love my experience with Grow Therapy. The platform is excellent and easy to use. The management provides great support for providers including marketing. Growing my practice with Grow Therapy!
review_text_con: None that I’ve been able to identify

review_title: Perfect place to start your own business
review_text_pro: Grow has been the whole reason I finally took the leap into private practice! All of the support covers everything I was afraid of doing for so many years. Grow has changed my life :) The compensation is very fair, especially considering there is no cost to sign up. They also always seems to be trying to improve in all areas, which is incredibly appreciated.
review_text_con: There are definitely some improvements that could be made on the platform as a whole, but again, they always seem to be working on improvements.

review_title: Amazing Growing Company With Work-Life Balance
review_person: Bilingual Customer Support Specialist in San Antonio, TX
review_text_pro: -Great Support from Leadership -Encouragement for work-life balance -Management makes the effort to make everyone feel part of something bigger -Genuine feeling of teamwork and comradery -Always in the know of developments, even at top executive level
review_text_con: -As a growing company there will still be fires to put out or challenges to deal with until more definitely established

review_text_pro: Freedom, decent pay, support during credentialling, lots if unexpected extras like discount CEUs.
review_text_con: Some issues with communication with the company, slow to respond to issues that need attention.

review_title: This is a great place to start or grow your existing practice.
review_text_pro: flexible work hours, support and finding clients, deals with insurance
review_text_con: can be slow in securing clients. but that works for me

review_person: Licensed Professional Counselor in Richmond, VA
review_text_pro: I’m an LPC who joined with Grow Therapy several months ago and could not be happier with my decision. Grow offers an extremely helpful community platform with an abundance of resources for getting started, private practice start up and admin, continuing education, referrals, and even self-care. They have a professional and responsive support team that are always there to provide answers to questions as needed. I’m impressed with their underlying mission to help providers grow professionally, their honest pay structure, and their dedication to inclusivity.
review_text_con: None. Providers are responsible for managing their own work-life balance; Grow is supportive of all.

review_person: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Merced, CA
review_text_pro: I can work at my own pace and grow my practice the way I want to. Pay compensation is good and referrals are consistent
review_text_con: I have only had good experiences with Grow therapy so far!

review_text_pro: Freedom, decent pay, support during credentialling, lots if unexpected extras like discount CEUs.
review_text_con: Some issues with communication with the company, slow to respond to issues that need attention.

review_title: This is a great place to start or grow your existing practice.
review_text_pro: flexible work hours, support and finding clients, deals with insurance
review_text_con: can be slow in securing clients. but that works for me

review_person: Licensed Professional Counselor in Richmond, VA
review_text_pro: I’m an LPC who joined with Grow Therapy several months ago and could not be happier with my decision. Grow offers an extremely helpful community platform with an abundance of resources for getting started, private practice start up and admin, continuing education, referrals, and even self-care. They have a professional and responsive support team that are always there to provide answers to questions as needed. I’m impressed with their underlying mission to help providers grow professionally, their honest pay structure, and their dedication to inclusivity.
review_text_con: None. Providers are responsible for managing their own work-life balance; Grow is supportive of all.

review_person: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Merced, CA
review_text_pro: I can work at my own pace and grow my practice the way I want to. Pay compensation is good and referrals are consistent
review_text_con: I have only had good experiences with Grow therapy so far!

review_text_pro: Flexible, step by step process to keep started,
review_text_con: Update website to easier functioning for client and providers

review_title: Makes having a private practice doable
review_person: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Dana Point, CA
review_text_pro: Grow Therapy has given me the opportunity to start my own private practice, without having to manage billing or finding new clients! I also love having access to other therapists for peer support!
review_text_con: I don’t have any cons so far!

review_person: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in Los Angeles, CA
review_text_pro: I have been on the Grow platform for almost 3 months and have had consistent client referrals since the first day. The compensation from the different insurance carriers has been fair and takes the stress off of my trying to keep up on payments.
review_text_con: The onboarding process can be lengthy.

review_title: People first company with an inspiring mission
review_text_pro: Pay/Benefits Leadership Flexibility Opportunity to be part of the positive change in healthcare
review_text_con: None that I can think of!

review_text_pro: A great way to build a private practice for clinicians looking to work with a diverse mixture of clients through insurance and/or private pay, and Grow Therapy takes care of admin support, from credentialing to marketing, billing and insurance reimbursement, and providing the electronic health record and scheduling calendar.
review_text_con: I have no significant negative concerns at this time.

review_text_pro: You're on you're own and reimbursement is great
review_text_con: You're on your own... Getting support takes a bit of time. No benefits

review_text_pro: Pay, community, quick response from team, clients
review_text_con: None at the present moment

review_title: start building your practice with Grow therapy
review_person: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Atlanta, GA
review_text_pro: great way to ease into private practice.... no hassle or fighting for reimbursement!
review_text_con: when patients don't pay, can't book, so you might lose clients

review_person: Therapist in West Palm Beach, FL
review_text_pro: My experience at Grow Therapy has been amazing. I was surprised by the ease of applying to join the many insurance panels and the lack of time it took. I was also impressed by the freedom it allows my previous clients to have in joining the site yet continuing to see me live. The site made it possible for clients who were previously swayed by my private, cash rates to utilize their insurance and continue in service with me. I have also appreciated the rapid payment schedules and reimbursements. Overall, my experience with Grow Therapy has exceeded my expectations.
review_text_con: None to report at this time.

review_text_pro: Flexibility, convenience, potential for growth, easy communication, and learning videos. I love access to trainings
review_text_con: None at this point right now

review_title: BEST Place to start a private practise
review_text_pro: if you are looking to start your own practice Grow makes it easy by completing credentialing and providing a platform for you
review_text_con: not their fault but credentialling is slow

review_text_pro: Super easy to get paneled, great rates, great EHR platform and awesome community board with supportive clinicians , flexible schedule
review_text_con: Some rates from insurances aren’t as good as others

review_title: Who says you can't find the prefect partner
review_text_pro: Deals with most insurance companies and always adding First-class consultation and support anytime, anywhere. Being able to say "I'm not available today" and mean it.
review_text_con: No insurance for contractors at this time.

review_title: Great Place to Work and Make a Difference
review_person: Operations Leader in Los Angeles, CA
review_text_pro: - Strong mission which everyone is working toward - Great colleagues where everyone is willing to help each other out - Building a culture of transparency to ensure folks at all levels have a sense of how the company is performing and where we’re heading - Competitive comp and benefits
review_text_con: It’s a startup so there are plenty of undefined processes but if you like to build things that can scale and last, you’ll enjoy this challenge. Also can occasionally have long hours, but compared to many other startups the hours haven’t been terrible and leadership has created benefits to encourage work life balance (e.g. once per week you can start 2 hours late for your personal life)

review_person: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Salem, MA
review_text_pro: Grow Therapy helps the provider build and maintain a private practice by taking over task such as scheduling and billing so the provider can focus on clinical issues. Their support system is strong both around clinical matters and operational issues.
review_text_con: None I can think about. They are great at taking feedback and working on it.

review_text_pro: Grow is a great way to start your own private practice. It is an intuitive system to use and the staff at Grow are beyond helpful. I easily started seeing clients and questions are answered quickly if needed. There is also a ton of community support offered via the platform.
review_text_con: No cons at this time

review_title: Great place, good mission, lots of energy
review_text_pro: Good people working on something important, smart and ambitious place with lots of room for growth
review_text_con: Can be a little hectic as with any startup!

review_title: Great Place to Start Your Business
review_text_pro: Excellent compensation Great community network Flexibility Ability to gain large caseload quickly
review_text_con: Calendar feature can use improvement

review_title: Thankful to be part of Grow
review_person: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
review_text_pro: Truly the first place I've worked where I felt valued. Team members are great to work with, ideas are valued, and I feel true ownership of my work.
review_text_con: Not a con or downside; I think there are some bumps in the onboarding process but I understand it's a rapidly growing (no pun intended) organization and I expect that they will smooth out that process as they are very open to feedback.

review_title: Grow Therapy makes it easy to practice
review_person: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Orlando, FL
review_text_pro: As a prescriber, I've utterly enjoyed working with Grow Therapy to grow my private practice. Having the flexibility to see the patients I want to see, when I want to see them and having the full support of Grow Therapy for billing makes practicing a lot easier and more enjoyable. Also they have created a community for providers and therapist to be able to communicate and learn from one another. That's been amazing!
review_text_con: I would like more patients to schedule but I know this takes time.

review_person: Mental Health Counselor in Miami, FL
review_text_pro: They help with my billing, questions I have about the therapy session, I receive guidance, I don’t feel alone it is the best team work.
review_text_con: The process to get the certification. For private insurance takes time

review_title: Great way to start your practice
review_text_pro: Plenty of support. Lots of opportunities to get clients. And the interface is very user friendly.
review_text_con: None right now for me.

review_text_pro: You're on you're own and reimbursement is great
review_text_con: You're on your own... Getting support takes a bit of time. No benefits

review_text_pro: Gets caseload very quickly, competitive pay, easy to use system
review_text_con: Some administrative errors but team responds quickly

review_title: Great company to support your private practice
review_text_pro: Grow Therapy has been a really supportive company that has helped me to start a private practice without the stress of doing everything by myself. They offer support, guidance, marketing tools, and resources to help therapists do what they love without all of the extra work in doing it alone. 5 stars!
review_text_con: No cons to list at this time

review_title: I love how Grow Therapy helps me to be an independent provider.
review_text_pro: comfort of working from home, fast and reliable reimbursement, staffs respond quickly to questions or issues.
review_text_con: I don't have any complaints, really.

review_person: Provider Success Associate in Denver, CO
review_text_pro: Wonderful team that is compassionate about what they are doing. No one is above the grunt work and a true team mindset. Company works to make both in office and remote employees feel heard and equipped to do their job. Tech company agility, without the "work yourself to death" mentality Hiring to stay ahead of expectations instead of expecting current employees to double output.
review_text_con: The company is new(er), and therefore growth potential and expectations are ever changing or not yet set, (but this has also been acknowledged and systems implemented to help fix). Inter-department/ team understanding of day to day workings can be lacking.

review_text_pro: The people are amazing to work with. I feel that the company truly cares deeply about the mental health of its employees, being a mental health company itself. Lots of opportunity to make a big impact!
review_text_con: There’s a fair amount of tech debt as a result of the breakneck development pace from ~1 year ago, which seems pretty standard for startups that are just launching. Things are much less hectic now!

review_person: Provider Success Associate in Portland, OR
review_text_pro: Really supportive colleagues who want you to succeed and will be there to help with anything, ability to WFH, really nice schedule and can be flexible depending on the day. Since it is WFH you are expected to manage your own time, which for myself is something I was looking for when switching careers. They are a mental health company and it shows by how they treat their employees. Overall, it's been a dream job for where I'm at now and can see myself working here for a long time.
review_text_con: None that i've found yet.

review_text_pro: At Grow, I have met some of the most incredible and inspiring colleagues I have ever worked with! The work is always evolving as the company grows itself, and the challenge feels dynamic. The leadership is very transparent about goals and progress, giving me a sense of ownership in our company's journey.
review_text_con: It can be painful to not give our customers everything they want all the time when some of our competitors do, but I feel confident in the decisions our teams have made and excited by the product we are building.

review_title: Great for new private practice owners
review_person: Licensed Professional Counselor in Suffolk, VA
review_text_pro: Work life balance Administrative assistance Simplified documentation
review_text_con: Sometimes frustrating to not be able to call and talk to someone when you need help.

review_title: You are your own boss here
review_person: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Allen, TX
review_text_pro: Flexible schedule No administration headache Get paid on time Support team in quick to response to your concerns Great support from peers for referral or questions
review_text_con: None I can think off

review_title: Great way to start your own practice
review_text_pro: Great work life balance. Great autonomy. Great support from the staff
review_text_con: There aren’t really any cons

review_text_pro: Easy to onboard and obtain cleints
review_text_con: Little interaction with peers due to being remote

review_title: Great mission, strong leadership, fun team
review_person: Product Manager in New York, NY
review_text_pro: Leadership cares about the employees, they have a strong vision for where we are going, the growth has been exciting and necessary, and it's amazing being able to work focused on a mission that I'm passionate about
review_text_con: It's a fast-moving team which can make some things harder, but it's for all the right reasons!

review_person: S S E(Senior Software Engineer) in New York, NY
review_text_pro: - High growth startup with tons of different avenues to learn - Very culture/mission driven, comes with a great set of coworkers - Great benefits around mental healthcare, along with general work life balance - Transparent founders
review_text_con: - It is a high growth startup, so it is very fast paced, and might not be for everybody

review_person: S S E(Senior Software Engineer) in New York, NY
review_text_pro: - High growth startup with tons of different avenues to learn - Very culture/mission driven, comes with a great set of coworkers - Great benefits around mental healthcare, along with general work life balance - Transparent founders
review_text_con: - It is a high growth startup, so it is very fast paced, and might not be for everybody

review_text_pro: I like the ease and ability of Grow Therapy to complete all the administrative tasks for clinicians. The platform is easy to use and community building within network of providers is a good way to support clinicians.
review_text_con: Need to make sure to communicate when the providers are paneled with insurance companies.

review_title: Great place to work if you want high impact work with a rewarding mission.
review_text_pro: * great mission - making provider's lives easier and increasing access to mental healthcare for the country * welcoming, friendly company and engineering culture * dogs in the office * diversity of work and autonomy * good compensation
review_text_con: * new department - not all the standard infrastructure yet, setting up new processes - comes with the size and can be fun to setup

review_title: Proud to be a part of this company!
review_text_pro: - Impacting the lives of providers who need support in private practice - Great and inclusive company culture - Support from every team member and a CEO who is active in our lives and our goals
review_text_con: As a start-up company, we are still working out communication and logistics, but we are quickly learning how to be a top-tier company for providers and employees alike!

review_title: Great company -- Proud to work here
review_person: Growth Manager in New York, NY
review_text_pro: - Compassionate Culture - Transparent Planning and Town Halls (Bi-Weekly) - Great Benefits - Positioned for Growth - Smart People - Remote Friendly - Mental Health space attracts passionate people who care about each other.
review_text_con: I haven't encountered any yet. It might be a con for some: It's a growing company, many processes haven't been worked out yet.

review_title: Great Work Culture and ability to work on impactful projects
review_text_pro: - Work Culture - Impactful Projects - Company values are reflected in internal goals/projects - Benefits - Easy to work remotely
review_text_con: - Not a true con but this is a start up and you have to flexible and willing to adapt to changes in priority

review_text_pro: Super supportive, quick to answer questions, even discounts on CEU’s with group discussions
review_text_con: None that I can see so far

review_title: Excellent opportunity to build private practice
review_person: Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist in Bridgeport, CT
review_text_pro: Flexibility Community support Easy platform- speedy response to any questions Insurance/billing/consent forms taken care of for you!!
review_text_con: Grow is for someone who is independent and wants flexibility I haven't found any cons so far.

review_text_pro: 1. Great Coworkers and Management. 2. Great Pay and Benefits. 3. It's genuinely great to work with smart, hardworking people who motivate you every day to get better at your craft. Not to mention, it is awesome getting to work in improving Mental Health Care access for people.
review_text_con: I haven't found any yet.

review_title: Great place to learn and Grow!
review_text_pro: Smart coworkers, energizing and welcoming environment, WLB
review_text_con: It's a startup, you'll have to ramp up and be productive quickly

review_text_pro: A great team working to help increase access to much needed mental health services
review_text_con: None that come to mind!

review_title: Great culture, great mission, great people
review_text_pro: Really great people to work at. Very collaborative and transparent. Leadership is great.
review_text_con: Fast pace. Things are a little bit disorganized. Probably not really a con given its stage.

review_text_pro: Grow Therapy is a great company to work for. The people on our team are so responsive, positive and understanding. I never feel hesitant to ask for help or ask questions when needed. We all strive to work well together as a team.
review_text_con: The job is demanding, but we understand the importance of delegating work appropriately so that no one gets burnt out!

review_text_pro: Grow cares about its employees and who it serves, flexible work environment, team effort made by all, forward thinking, and best of all a culture that allows for idea sharing and is always willing to listen to all employees.
review_text_con: I cannot think of any downsides grow is great to work for!

review_text_pro: The company has shown that it's not only mission driven, but also people + employee success driven. A team of passionate people coming together with intention and placing value on work that they're doing and valuing their people while doing so!
review_text_con: I can't think of one thing.

review_title: So happy I came to Grow!
review_text_pro: I’ve been working at Grow for two months and I absolutely love it - I have tons of autonomy to make my own decisions but I also have the support of the corporate team behind me as well. I really feel like a partner at Grow rather than just another employee
review_text_con: Onboarding process is somewhat long
